tn.text: This word is used here to mark a break in the main storyline. Here the writer begins to provide background information. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
This refers to the list of kings that continues through verse 24.
These are the names of places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Translate these words in the same way you did in [[:en:bible:notes:jos:09:09|9:10]].
This is a place. Translate the same way as in [[:en:bible:notes:jos:11:01|11:2]].

tn.ref: Beth Jeshimoth ... Mount Pisgah ... Ashtaroth ... Edrei ... Salecah
tn.text: These are the names of places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Translate these words in the same way you did in [[:en:bible:notes:jos:09:09|9:10]].
These are the names of people groups. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are the descendants of Reuben.
These are the descendants of Gad.
They are called a half tribe because the other half of the tribe received an inheritance in the land of Canaan.
These are the names of places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are the names of cities. Translate "Jarmuth," "Lachish," and "Eglon" in the same way you did in [[:en:bible:notes:jos:10:03|10:3]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Debir ... Geder ... Hormah ... Arad ... Libnah ... Adullam ... Makkedah
tn.text: These are the names of cities. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Tappuah ... Hepher ... Aphek ... Lasharon ... Madon ... Hazor ... Shimron Meron ... Akshaph
tn.text: These are the names of cities. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Taanach ... Megiddo ... Kedesh ... Jokneam ... Dor ... Goyim ... Tirzah
tn.text: These are the names of cities. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
